00032 static __inline int __hwloc_attribute_pure
00033 hwloc_get_type_or_below_depth (hwloc_topology_t topology, hwloc_obj_type_t type)
00034 {
00035   int depth = hwloc_get_type_depth(topology, type);
00036 
00037   if (depth != HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_UNKNOWN)
00038     return depth;
00039 
00040   /* find the highest existing level with type order >= */
00041   for(depth = hwloc_get_type_depth(topology, HWLOC_OBJ_PU); ; depth--)
00042     if (hwloc_compare_types(hwloc_get_depth_type(topology, depth), type) < 0)
00043       return depth+1;
00044 
00045   /* Shouldn't ever happen, as there is always a SYSTEM level with lower order and known depth.  */
00046   abort();
00047 }
00048 
00055 static __inline int __hwloc_attribute_pure
00056 hwloc_get_type_or_above_depth (hwloc_topology_t topology, hwloc_obj_type_t type)
00057 {
00058   int depth = hwloc_get_type_depth(topology, type);
00059 
00060   if (depth != HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_UNKNOWN)
00061     return depth;
00062 
00063   /* find the lowest existing level with type order <= */
00064   for(depth = 0; ; depth++)
00065     if (hwloc_compare_types(hwloc_get_depth_type(topology, depth), type) > 0)
00066       return depth-1;
00067 
00068   /* Shouldn't ever happen, as there is always a PU level with higher order and known depth.  */
00069   abort();
00070 }

00086 static __inline hwloc_obj_t __hwloc_attribute_pure
00087 hwloc_get_root_obj (hwloc_topology_t topology)
00088 {
00089   return hwloc_get_obj_by_depth (topology, 0, 0);
00090 }
00091 
00092 static __inline hwloc_obj_t __hwloc_attribute_deprecated
00093 hwloc_get_system_obj (hwloc_topology_t topology) { return hwloc_get_root_obj (topology); }
00094 
00096 static __inline hwloc_obj_t __hwloc_attribute_pure
00097 hwloc_get_ancestor_obj_by_depth (hwloc_topology_t topology __hwloc_attribute_unused, unsigned depth, hwloc_obj_t obj)
00098 {
00099   hwloc_obj_t ancestor = obj;
00100   if (obj->depth < depth)
00101     return NULL;
00102   while (ancestor && ancestor->depth > depth)
00103     ancestor = ancestor->parent;
00104   return ancestor;
00105 }
00106 
00108 static __inline hwloc_obj_t __hwloc_attribute_pure
00109 hwloc_get_ancestor_obj_by_type (hwloc_topology_t topology __hwloc_attribute_unused, hwloc_obj_type_t type, hwloc_obj_t obj)
00110 {
00111   hwloc_obj_t ancestor = obj->parent;
00112   while (ancestor && ancestor->type != type)
00113     ancestor = ancestor->parent;
00114   return ancestor;
00115 }
00116 
00121 static __inline hwloc_obj_t
00122 hwloc_get_next_obj_by_depth (hwloc_topology_t topology, unsigned depth, hwloc_obj_t prev)
00123 {
00124   if (!prev)
00125     return hwloc_get_obj_by_depth (topology, depth, 0);
00126   if (prev->depth != depth)
00127     return NULL;
00128   return prev->next_cousin;
00129 }
00130 
00137 static __inline hwloc_obj_t
00138 hwloc_get_next_obj_by_type (hwloc_topology_t topology, hwloc_obj_type_t type,
00139                    hwloc_obj_t prev)
00140 {
00141   int depth = hwloc_get_type_depth(topology, type);
00142   if (depth == HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_UNKNOWN || depth == HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_MULTIPLE)
00143     return NULL;
00144   return hwloc_get_next_obj_by_depth (topology, depth, prev);
00145 }
00146 
00155 static __inline hwloc_obj_t __hwloc_attribute_pure
00156 hwloc_get_pu_obj_by_os_index(hwloc_topology_t topology, unsigned os_index)
00157 {
00158   hwloc_obj_t obj = NULL;
00159   while ((obj = hwloc_get_next_obj_by_type(topology, HWLOC_OBJ_PU, obj)) != NULL)
00160     if (obj->os_index == os_index)
00161       return obj;
00162   return NULL;
00163 }
00164 
00169 static __inline hwloc_obj_t
00170 hwloc_get_next_child (hwloc_topology_t topology __hwloc_attribute_unused, hwloc_obj_t parent, hwloc_obj_t prev)
00171 {
00172   if (!prev)
00173     return parent->first_child;
00174   if (prev->parent != parent)
00175     return NULL;
00176   return prev->next_sibling;
00177 }
00178 
00180 static __inline hwloc_obj_t __hwloc_attribute_pure
00181 hwloc_get_common_ancestor_obj (hwloc_topology_t topology __hwloc_attribute_unused, hwloc_obj_t obj1, hwloc_obj_t obj2)
00182 {
00183   while (obj1->depth > obj2->depth)
00184     obj1 = obj1->parent;
00185   while (obj2->depth > obj1->depth)
00186     obj2 = obj2->parent;
00187   while (obj1 != obj2) {
00188     obj1 = obj1->parent;
00189     obj2 = obj2->parent;
00190   }
00191   return obj1;
00192 }
00193 
00196 static __inline int __hwloc_attribute_pure
00197 hwloc_obj_is_in_subtree (hwloc_topology_t topology __hwloc_attribute_unused, hwloc_obj_t obj, hwloc_obj_t subtree_root)
00198 {
00199   return hwloc_cpuset_isincluded(obj->cpuset, subtree_root->cpuset);
00200 }

00218 static __inline hwloc_obj_t
00219 hwloc_get_first_largest_obj_inside_cpuset(hwloc_topology_t topology, hwloc_const_cpuset_t set)
00220 {
00221   hwloc_obj_t obj = hwloc_get_root_obj(topology);
00222   if (!hwloc_cpuset_intersects(obj->cpuset, set))
00223     return NULL;
00224   while (!hwloc_cpuset_isincluded(obj->cpuset, set)) {
00225     /* while the object intersects without being included, look at its children */
00226     hwloc_obj_t child = NULL;
00227     while ((child = hwloc_get_next_child(topology, obj, child)) != NULL) {
00228       if (hwloc_cpuset_intersects(child->cpuset, set))
00229         break;
00230     }
00231     if (!child)
00232       /* no child intersects, return their father */
00233       return obj;
00234     /* found one intersecting child, look at its children */
00235     obj = child;
00236   }
00237   /* obj is included, return it */
00238   return obj;
00239 }

00245 HWLOC_DECLSPEC int hwloc_get_largest_objs_inside_cpuset (hwloc_topology_t topology, hwloc_const_cpuset_t set,
00246                                                  hwloc_obj_t * __hwloc_restrict objs, int max);

00254 static __inline hwloc_obj_t
00255 hwloc_get_next_obj_inside_cpuset_by_depth (hwloc_topology_t topology, hwloc_const_cpuset_t set,
00256                                            unsigned depth, hwloc_obj_t prev)
00257 {
00258   hwloc_obj_t next = hwloc_get_next_obj_by_depth(topology, depth, prev);
00259   while (next && !hwloc_cpuset_isincluded(next->cpuset, set))
00260     next = next->next_cousin;
00261   return next;
00262 }

00270 static __inline hwloc_obj_t
00271 hwloc_get_next_obj_inside_cpuset_by_type (hwloc_topology_t topology, hwloc_const_cpuset_t set,
00272                                           hwloc_obj_type_t type, hwloc_obj_t prev)
00273 {
00274   int depth = hwloc_get_type_depth(topology, type);
00275   if (depth == HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_UNKNOWN || depth == HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_MULTIPLE)
00276     return NULL;
00277   return hwloc_get_next_obj_inside_cpuset_by_depth(topology, set, depth, prev);
00278 }
00279 
00282 static __inline hwloc_obj_t __hwloc_attribute_pure
00283 hwloc_get_obj_inside_cpuset_by_depth (hwloc_topology_t topology, hwloc_const_cpuset_t set,
00284                                       unsigned depth, unsigned idx)
00285 {
00286   unsigned count = 0;
00287   hwloc_obj_t obj = hwloc_get_obj_by_depth (topology, depth, 0);
00288   while (obj) {
00289     if (hwloc_cpuset_isincluded(obj->cpuset, set)) {
00290       if (count == idx)
00291         return obj;
00292       count++;
00293     }
00294     obj = obj->next_cousin;
00295   }
00296   return NULL;
00297 }
00298 
00305 static __inline hwloc_obj_t __hwloc_attribute_pure
00306 hwloc_get_obj_inside_cpuset_by_type (hwloc_topology_t topology, hwloc_const_cpuset_t set,
00307                                      hwloc_obj_type_t type, unsigned idx)
00308 {
00309   int depth = hwloc_get_type_depth(topology, type);
00310   if (depth == HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_UNKNOWN || depth == HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_MULTIPLE)
00311     return NULL;
00312   return hwloc_get_obj_inside_cpuset_by_depth(topology, set, depth, idx);
00313 }

00316 static __inline unsigned __hwloc_attribute_pure
00317 hwloc_get_nbobjs_inside_cpuset_by_depth (hwloc_topology_t topology, hwloc_const_cpuset_t set,
00318                                          unsigned depth)
00319 {
00320   hwloc_obj_t obj = hwloc_get_obj_by_depth (topology, depth, 0);
00321   int count = 0;
00322   while (obj) {
00323     if (hwloc_cpuset_isincluded(obj->cpuset, set))
00324       count++;
00325     obj = obj->next_cousin;
00326   }
00327   return count;
00328 }
00329 
00336 static __inline int __hwloc_attribute_pure
00337 hwloc_get_nbobjs_inside_cpuset_by_type (hwloc_topology_t topology, hwloc_const_cpuset_t set,
00338                                         hwloc_obj_type_t type)
00339 {
00340   int depth = hwloc_get_type_depth(topology, type);
00341   if (depth == HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_UNKNOWN)
00342     return 0;
00343   if (depth == HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_MULTIPLE)
00344     return -1; /* FIXME: agregate nbobjs from different levels? */
00345   return hwloc_get_nbobjs_inside_cpuset_by_depth(topology, set, depth);
00346 }

00360 static __inline hwloc_obj_t __hwloc_attribute_pure
00361 hwloc_get_child_covering_cpuset (hwloc_topology_t topology __hwloc_attribute_unused, hwloc_const_cpuset_t set,
00362                                 hwloc_obj_t parent)
00363 {
00364   hwloc_obj_t child;
00365 
00366   if (hwloc_cpuset_iszero(set))
00367     return NULL;
00368 
00369   child = parent->first_child;
00370   while (child) {
00371     if (hwloc_cpuset_isincluded(set, child->cpuset))
00372       return child;
00373     child = child->next_sibling;
00374   }
00375   return NULL;
00376 }
00377 
00382 static __inline hwloc_obj_t __hwloc_attribute_pure
00383 hwloc_get_obj_covering_cpuset (hwloc_topology_t topology, hwloc_const_cpuset_t set)
00384 {
00385   struct hwloc_obj *current = hwloc_get_root_obj(topology);
00386 
00387   if (hwloc_cpuset_iszero(set))
00388     return NULL;
00389 
00390   if (!hwloc_cpuset_isincluded(set, current->cpuset))
00391     return NULL;
00392 
00393   while (1) {
00394     hwloc_obj_t child = hwloc_get_child_covering_cpuset(topology, set, current);
00395     if (!child)
00396       return current;
00397     current = child;
00398   }
00399 }

00417 static __inline hwloc_obj_t
00418 hwloc_get_next_obj_covering_cpuset_by_depth(hwloc_topology_t topology, hwloc_const_cpuset_t set,
00419                                             unsigned depth, hwloc_obj_t prev)
00420 {
00421   hwloc_obj_t next = hwloc_get_next_obj_by_depth(topology, depth, prev);
00422   while (next && !hwloc_cpuset_intersects(set, next->cpuset))
00423     next = next->next_cousin;
00424   return next;
00425 }

00441                                            hwloc_obj_type_t type, hwloc_obj_t prev)

00444   if (depth == HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_UNKNOWN || depth == HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_MULTIPLE)
00445     return NULL;

00461 static __inline hwloc_obj_t __hwloc_attribute_pure
00462 hwloc_get_cache_covering_cpuset (hwloc_topology_t topology, hwloc_const_cpuset_t set)
00463 {
00464   hwloc_obj_t current = hwloc_get_obj_covering_cpuset(topology, set);
00465   while (current) {
00466     if (current->type == HWLOC_OBJ_CACHE)
00467       return current;
00468     current = current->parent;
00469   }
00470   return NULL;
00471 }
00472 
00477 static __inline hwloc_obj_t __hwloc_attribute_pure
00478 hwloc_get_shared_cache_covering_obj (hwloc_topology_t topology __hwloc_attribute_unused, hwloc_obj_t obj)
00479 {
00480   hwloc_obj_t current = obj->parent;
00481   while (current) {
00482     if (!hwloc_cpuset_isequal(current->cpuset, obj->cpuset)
00483         && current->type == HWLOC_OBJ_CACHE)
00484       return current;
00485     current = current->parent;
00486   }
00487   return NULL;
00488 }

00518 static __inline hwloc_obj_t __hwloc_attribute_pure
00519 hwloc_get_obj_below_by_type (hwloc_topology_t topology,
00520                              hwloc_obj_type_t type1, unsigned idx1,
00521                              hwloc_obj_type_t type2, unsigned idx2)
00522 {
00523   hwloc_obj_t obj;
00524 
00525   obj = hwloc_get_obj_by_type (topology, type1, idx1);
00526   if (!obj)
00527     return NULL;
00528 
00529   return hwloc_get_obj_inside_cpuset_by_type(topology, obj->cpuset, type2, idx2);
00530 }

00547 static __inline hwloc_obj_t __hwloc_attribute_pure
00548 hwloc_get_obj_below_array_by_type (hwloc_topology_t topology, int nr, hwloc_obj_type_t *typev, unsigned *idxv)
00549 {
00550   hwloc_obj_t obj = hwloc_get_root_obj(topology);
00551   int i;
00552 
00553   for(i=0; i<nr; i++) {
00554     obj = hwloc_get_obj_inside_cpuset_by_type(topology, obj->cpuset, typev[i], idxv[i]);
00555     if (!obj)
00556       return NULL;
00557   }
00558 
00559   return obj;
00560 }
00561 
00582 static __inline void
00583 hwloc_distribute(hwloc_topology_t topology, hwloc_obj_t root, hwloc_cpuset_t *cpuset, unsigned n)
00584 {
00585   unsigned i;
00586   unsigned u;
00587   unsigned chunk_size, complete_chunks;
00588   hwloc_cpuset_t *cpusetp;
00589 
00590   if (!root->arity || n == 1) {
00591     /* Got to the bottom, we can't split any more, put everything there.  */
00592     for (i=0; i<n; i++)
00593       cpuset[i] = hwloc_cpuset_dup(root->cpuset);
00594     return;
00595   }
00596 
00597   /* Divide n in root->arity chunks.  */
00598   chunk_size = (n + root->arity - 1) / root->arity;
00599   complete_chunks = n % root->arity;
00600   if (!complete_chunks)
00601     complete_chunks = root->arity;
00602 
00603   /* Allocate complete chunks first.  */
00604   for (cpusetp = cpuset, i = 0;
00605        i < complete_chunks;
00606        i ++, cpusetp += chunk_size)
00607     hwloc_distribute(topology, root->children[i], cpusetp, chunk_size);
00608 
00609   /* Now allocate not-so-complete chunks.  */
00610   for (u = i;
00611        u < root->arity;
00612        u++, cpusetp += chunk_size-1)
00613     hwloc_distribute(topology, root->children[u], cpusetp, chunk_size-1);
00614 }

00621 /* \brief Get complete CPU set
00622  *
00623  * \return the complete CPU set of logical processors of the system. If the
00624  * topology is the result of a combination of several systems, NULL is
00625  * returned.
00626  *
00627  * \note The returned cpuset is not newly allocated and should thus not be
00628  * changed or freed; hwloc_cpuset_dup must be used to obtain a local copy.
00629  */
00630 static __inline hwloc_const_cpuset_t __hwloc_attribute_pure
00631 hwloc_topology_get_complete_cpuset(hwloc_topology_t topology)
00632 {
00633   return hwloc_get_root_obj(topology)->complete_cpuset;
00634 }
00635 
00636 /* \brief Get topology CPU set
00637  *
00638  * \return the CPU set of logical processors of the system for which hwloc
00639  * provides topology information. This is equivalent to the cpuset of the
00640  * system object. If the topology is the result of a combination of several
00641  * systems, NULL is returned.
00642  *
00643  * \note The returned cpuset is not newly allocated and should thus not be
00644  * changed or freed; hwloc_cpuset_dup must be used to obtain a local copy.
00645  */
00646 static __inline hwloc_const_cpuset_t __hwloc_attribute_pure
00647 hwloc_topology_get_topology_cpuset(hwloc_topology_t topology)
00648 {
00649   return hwloc_get_root_obj(topology)->cpuset;
00650 }
00651 
00661 static __inline hwloc_const_cpuset_t __hwloc_attribute_pure
00662 hwloc_topology_get_online_cpuset(hwloc_topology_t topology)
00663 {
00664   return hwloc_get_root_obj(topology)->online_cpuset;
00665 }

00676 static __inline hwloc_const_cpuset_t __hwloc_attribute_pure
00677 hwloc_topology_get_allowed_cpuset(hwloc_topology_t topology)
00678 {
00679   return hwloc_get_root_obj(topology)->allowed_cpuset;
00680 }
